author: Jennifer Hansler, and Khalil Abdallah, CNN
title: Group of Palestinian-Americans skip Blinken meeting over Biden admin’s support for Israel’s offensive in Gaza
text:
(CNN) — A number of Palestinian-Americans refused to attend a roundtable meeting with US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Thursday to discuss the
situation in Gaza in protest against the Biden administration’s ongoing support for Israel’s offensive in the war-torn strip – a military campaign that has exacted a massive humanitarian toll.
“We do not know what more Secretary Blinken or President (Joe) Biden need to hear or see to compel them to end their complicity in this genocide,” several of those who rejected the invitation said in a press statement distributed by the non-profit Institute for Middle East Understanding (IMEU).
“They show us every day whose lives they value and whose lives they consider disposable. We will not be attending this discussion which can only amount to a box-ticking exercise. Our families, our community and all Palestinians deserve better,” the signatories wrote.
“There is one thing that we, our community and countless others around the US and the world, including American unions representing nearly 8 million workers and at least 47 US cities, have been asking of this administration: to demand a permanent ceasefire to save Palestinians lives and stop the destruction of Gaza,” they wrote. “A meeting of this nature at this moment in time is insulting and performative.”
Blinken and other members of the Biden administration have
called on Israel to do more to protect civilians and allow more humanitarian aid into Gaza. The officials, however, have continually rejected the idea of a ceasefire, instead advocating for “humanitarian pauses.”
Thursday’s meeting with Blinken comes amid continued outrage from many progressive Democrats, Muslim and younger voters about the administration’s handling of Gaza – opposition that poses a growing political problem for Biden. The refusal of several invitees to attend underscores the immense anger felt by many in the United States – including some within the federal government – over the toll from the conflict, which was launched following
Hamas’ brutal attack on Israel on October 7. More than 26,000 have been killed, hundreds of thousands have been displaced, and Gaza is on the brink of famine. More than 200 Israeli soldiers have been killed in the offensive.
Six people did attend the meeting, a source familiar told CNN, and those who attended felt conflicted about doing so, but felt they should take advantage of the opportunity to speak to the need for urgent change in US policy toward Gaza.
‘Soul-searching’
One of the invitees to the roundtable, Dr. Tariq Haddad, said in an intensely personal, 12-page letter to Blinken that he initially intended to go to the meeting.
However, “after a lot of soul-searching I have decided that I cannot in good conscience meet with you today knowing this administration’s policies have been responsible for the death of over 80 of my family members including dozens of children, the suffering of hundreds of my remaining family, the famine my family is currently subjected to and the destruction of all my family’s homes,” Haddad wrote in the letter.
“The more I thought about this meeting, the more I could not emotionally bring myself to look you in the eyes, Secretary Blinken, knowing you and President Biden have knowingly contributed to the suffering and murder of so many of my family, the homelessness and dispossession of 2 million Gazans, and the famine that has befallen my remaining family members,” Haddad said.
“How does one meet for what I was told would be 3 minutes, with a person you hold responsible for not just the killing of your child, but rather the murder of over 80 of your family members?” he asked in his letter.
“How do I look you in the eyes knowing you couldn’t even do the basic minimum like calling for a ceasefire to end the suffering and carnage, and even worse, are cutting off humanitarian assistance to 2 million people going through a famine of historic proportions,” he wrote, appearing to reference the suspension of US aid to the UN’s main relief agency in Gaza, UNRWA.
“My family are subsisting on animal feed, Secretary Blinken, because of your policies,” he said.
“You could have called for a cease-fire at any point in the past four months and ended all this suffering and death, and you have not. You could have used your diplomatic pressure to end the suffering, and you chose not to. You could have recognized that shutting off aid to an area that is experiencing the worst famine and human rights disaster in modern history is unethical, yet you chose not to. This is why it is very difficult emotionally for me to meet you today, to somehow normalize a meeting with an administration that continues day after day to cause so much suffering and death with their policies,” he wrote.
Haddad urged Blinken to call for an immediate ceasefire, “end the continued transfer of US military reserve equipment to the Israeli military to stop further murder,” “call for an immediate withdrawal out of Gaza and equality for the Palestinian people,” and a “call for an end to the Israeli occupation, for equal rights, freedoms, and laws in this land regardless of one’s religion, ethnicity, or background.”
Haddad told CNN that the letter – in which he also included photos of some of his relatives who have been killed – was going to be handed directly to Blinken at Thursday’s meeting.
The source familiar with the meeting said some parts of it were read out loud to the top US diplomat during the hour-and-a-half long session at the State Department. That source said Blinken seemed engaged, but largely stuck to talking points in his remarks.
At a briefing Thursday, State Department spokesperson Matt Miller confirmed that Blinken met with “a number of leaders in the Palestinian-American community.”
“It was the latest in a series of meetings that the Secretary has had with individuals and organizations both within the department and from outside the department that hold a wide range of views across the ideological and political spectrum,” Miller said. “He has held these meetings because he thinks it’s important to hear directly from individuals as I said, both inside the State Department and outside the State Department.”
“He finds that process to be constructive. It informs his thinking. It helps him, he believes, shape policy in the best way possible,” he said.
Public opposition
And while Blinken was quietly confronted behind closed doors about the administration’s policy toward Gaza on Thursday, members of the administration, including Blinken, have also faced public displays of opposition. A number of protesters have camped in front of Blinken’s house since last Friday to try to pressure a change in policy.
At a public speech on Tuesday, Samantha Power, head of the US Agency for International Development (USAID) was twice confronted about the administration’s position toward Gaza.
One questioner, who identified herself as a USAID contractor, asked Power about the loss of the US’ ability “to be moral leaders” due to the “US funded genocide in Gaza.” Another person interrupted her speech to raise the massive humanitarian toll.
“It is a devastating situation where not enough resources are getting in, via the Rafah crossing or the Kerem Shalom crossing,” Power said. “And we are working 24/7 to try to dramatically expand the flow of food, medicine, shelter – I mean, so much is needed. But, you know, you have families right now that are living in unimaginable conditions.”
“In addition, of course, the greatest loss of life has come from the war itself and from the bombing, and more than 25,000 civilians have been killed. There is not a single call that President Biden makes, or engagement that anybody in the Biden administration does, that doesn’t put the importance of civilian protection and international humanitarian law, at the top of the conversation,” she said.
A USAID spokesperson said that “since the start of this conflict, Administrator Power and other Agency leadership have held numerous engagements with staff in the US and at USAID Missions around the world to discuss the US and USAID response to the conflict, offer appreciation for their work, and hear a range of perspectives and concerns.”
The-CNN-Wire

author: Diego Bastarrica
title: Google acaba de lanzar la primera versión beta de Android 15. Estas son las novedades - Digital Trends Español
text:
Joe Maring / DT Google acaba de lanzar la primera versión beta pública de Android 15, lo que marca el final de la fase de prueba centrada en los desarrolladores . El lanzamiento de la versión beta también significa que Android 15 finalmente está en un estado en el que puede ser probado por las masas sin que las personas tengan que preocuparse de que demasiados errores dejen su teléfono en un estado lamentable.
La primera versión beta de Android 15 no presenta un montón de funciones nuevas, ya que la mayoría de las adiciones notables ya han aparecido en las compilaciones de Developer Preview. Sin embargo, la publicación del blog de Google menciona las siguientes características como los aspectos más destacados
Compatibilidad a nivel de sistema operativo para el archivado de aplicaciones : esto significa que ahora puede archivar de forma segura una aplicación que ya no está en uso activo desde la aplicación Configuración. Al hacerlo, se libera una parte significativa del espacio de almacenamiento ocupado por la aplicación mientras se conservan solo unos pocos archivos cruciales. La próxima vez que necesite usar la aplicación, simplemente seleccione Restaurar para recuperarla en lugar de ir a Play Store y descargarla una vez más. Comunicación mejorada : Con la primera versión beta de Android 15, Google agrega soporte para dispositivos Braille a través de conexiones cableadas e inalámbricas para usuarios con problemas de visión. Contactos cifrados : La última actualización agrega una nueva función que protege la información de contacto almacenada en su teléfono detrás de una capa de cifrado de extremo a extremo. Este sistema de seguridad se horneará a nivel de sistema operativo. Recommended Videos Si está interesado en las adiciones más significativas, hay muchas en Android 15. Por ejemplo, hay un sistema de enfriamiento que silencia gradualmente el aluvión de notificaciones provenientes de una sola aplicación.
Related Google acaba de anunciar 8 grandes actualizaciones de Android Google anuncia Android 15; estas son sus novedades El rival ChatGPT de Google acaba de lanzarse en la búsqueda Luego está la función de compartir pantalla parcial que solo registra la actividad dentro de una sola aplicación seleccionada. Cualquier otra cosa que hagas durante una captura de pantalla no aparece en el video final.
Los controles Bluetooth son más ágiles y de fácil acceso, especialmente si tiene varios dispositivos conectados a su teléfono. Para las personas condenadas a las videollamadas diarias y a las malas cámaras web, ha llegado un nuevo ajuste preestablecido HD que permite que su teléfono funcione como una cámara de reunión de alta resolución para su PC.
Buscar en Google La experiencia de manejo de PDF, terriblemente privada de funciones, finalmente está mejorando con Android 15, mientras que el modo No molestar está agregando más flexibilidad. Algunas mejoras de rendimiento también están en el horizonte, y la pequeña pantalla de cubierta en los teléfonos plegables estilo plegable finalmente será compatible con más actividades de aplicaciones. No se requieren más hacks, pero aún no podrá ejecutar Call of Duty Mobile en la pantalla de portada de forma nativa. No es que sea una buena experiencia, solo digo que es posible y que deberías intentarlo una vez en la vida para sentirte como un renegado digital.
Google todavía planea lanzar tres actualizaciones beta adicionales entre ahora y julio, con el lanzamiento final de Android 15 programado para algún tiempo después de eso.
Recomendaciones del editor Android 15: mensajería satelital y mucho más de lo que llegará Oficial: los primeros celulares con actualización a Android 15 Las 5 nuevas funciones de Android que anunció Google en CES 2024 La primera versión beta de Android 14 acaba de aterrizar Google le da a Android 13 un truco de magia para la música

author: lepoint.fr
title: Météo : 9 départements en vigilance orange canicule, 3 en vigilance crues
text:
--> L' épisode caniculaire poursuit son atténuation. Il ne reste plus que neuf départements en vigilance orange canicule ce vendredi 2 août, avec des températures encore largement au-dessus des normales de saison. Ils sont essentiellement concentrés près de la Méditerranée : Alpes-de-Haute-Provence, Alpes-Maritimes, Bouches-du-Rhône, Gard, Hérault, Vaucluse, Var, Haute-Corse et Corse-du-Sud.
Le point du soir Tous les soirs à partir de 18h
Recevez l’information analysée et décryptée par la rédaction du Point.
Votre adresse email Votre adresse email n'est pas valide
Veuillez renseigner votre adresse email
Merci !
Votre inscription a bien été prise en compte avec l'adresse email :
Pour découvrir toutes nos autres newsletters, rendez-vous ici : MonCompte
En vous inscrivant, vous acceptez les conditions générales d’utilisations et notre politique de confidentialité .
Au bord de la mer, les minimales seront ainsi encore très élevées ce vendredi matin, entre 22 °C et 27 °C, selon le bulletin de Météo- France . Le prévisionniste national prévoit également de fortes chaleurs du Languedoc à la Provence dans l'après-midi, le thermomètre oscillant entre les 30 et 36 °C. Du côté du Var, le mercure pourra atteindre 39 °C. À Marseille, qui accueille les épreuves olympiques de voile , 31 °C sont attendus.
Sur le reste de l'Hexagone, les fortes chaleurs sont en net recul . Les minimales sont comprises entre 14 et 18 °C sur un quart nord-ouest et de 17 à 21 °C sur le reste du pays. En bord de Manche et le long de la côte atlantique, le thermomètre ne dépassera pas les 25 °C dans l'après-midi. 27 °C sont attendus à Paris avec des éclaircies.
@VigiMeteofrance 02 août
Pour vendredi 02 août 2024 :
�� 12 départements en Vigilance orange
Pour samedi 03 août 2024 :
�� 12 départements en Vigilance orange
Restez prudents et informés : https://t.co/JGz4rTUvHP pic.twitter.com/or1vbVt80I
— VigiMétéoFrance (@VigiMeteoFrance) August 2, 2024 Des averses orageuses prévues vendredi Trois départements d'Île-de-France et de l'Est ont par ailleurs été placés en vigilance orange pour les risques de crues (Seine-et-Marne, Meurthe-et-Moselle et Vosges) dans la soirée du jeudi 1 er août. De violents orages et de fortes précipitations ont éclaté localement, comme à Paris, provoquant l'interruption du match des Bleus qui affrontaient la Serbie en basket pour les JO .
#Paris2024 | ❌ LE MATCH EST INTERROMPU !
⛈️ Le terrain est trop humide à cause de la pluie et oblige l'arbitre à suspendre cette rencontre entre la Serbie et la France. pic.twitter.com/83GJsBqvYM
— francetvsport (@francetvsport) August 1, 2024 De fortes précipitations ont également concerné la Seine-et-Marne, avec 80 à 100 m de pluie à l'est de Coulommiers. Au sud-est de ce département, entre 50 à 80 mm de précipitations sont tombés entre Fontainebleau et Nemours, selon Météo-France. Dans les Vosges, le Mandon est sorti de son lit. Sur l'ensemble de la France, l'observatoire français Keraunos a recensé plus de 46 000 éclairs dans la nuit.
Ces averses orageuses vont persister ce vendredi matin, notamment sur le nord-est du pays. D'après Météo-France, elles vont progressivement gagner le centre-est et le nord de la Provence. Dans le Sud-Ouest, le ciel est assez nuageux et donnera aussi quelques pluies sur l'Aquitaine.
À LIRE AUSSI Canicule, dôme, plume : le lexique des grandes chaleurs Cette météo très chaude et électrique devrait toucher à sa fin ce week-end. Météo-France indique cependant que les Alpes-Maritimes, les Alpes-de-Haute-Provence et le Vaucluse sortiront de la vigilance orange canicule ce samedi à 6 heures. Ce sera également le cas du Var, du Gard et de l'Hérault dès 22 heures. Seuls trois départements (les deux de la Corse et les Bouches-du-Rhône) devraient toujours être concernés par cette vigilance orange dimanche matin.
À ne pas manquer Canicule : sept astuces pour rester au frais (sans climatiseur) Ressenti 55 degrés à Paris ? Qu’est-ce que l’indice Humidex qui calcule la chaleur ressentie Signaler un contenu abusif

author: Team Reports
title: Basketball Recap: St. Amant Comes Up Short
text:
After flying high against Prairieville last Friday, St. Amant came back down to earth. The St. Amant Gators fell 60-51 to the East Ascension Spartans on Saturday. While losing is never fun, the Gators can't take it too hard given the team's big disadvantage in MaxPreps' Louisiana basketball rankings (they are ranked 96th, while the Spartans are ranked 25th).
St. Amant's defeat was their first in the district, dropping their district record down to 3-1 and their overall record down to 19-18. As for East Ascension, their win was their sixth straight at home, which pushed their record up to 12-4.
St. Amant has already played their next game, a 70-33 loss against Prairieville on the 27th. As for East Ascension, they also didn't take long to hit the court again: they've already played their next match, an 83-45 victory against Lake Arthur on the 27th.
Article generated by infoSentience based on data entered on MaxPreps

author: VNExplorer
title: Footy coach dealt major health update after being hospitalised in New York on Christmas Day
text:
Sam Mitchell has been discharged from hospital He spent Christmas in a hospital bed Hawks coach not been cleared to fly home
Sam Mitchell has been discharged from hospital in New York after spending Christmas in care.
The Hawthorn coach, 41, was hospitalised with a deteriorating condition of pneumonia, meaning he had to spend Christmas Day in a hospital bed.
Mitchell was admitted to New York University Hospital on December 23 and his Hawthorn players were informed of his health episode that same day,
‘His health continues to improve and he will remain in New York until he’s in a position to fly home to Australia,’ said 7News reporter Mitch Cleary.
Cleary added that Mitchell will remain surrounded by his wife, Lyndall, and three children until he is given the all-clear to return to Melbourne.
Sam Mitchell has been discharged from hospital after he fell ill over Christmas
‘Importantly, Sam is improving and recovering well,’ Hawks CEO Ash Klein said.
‘The club has been in regular contact with Lyndall and we will obviously continue to support in any way we can,’ he added.
Pneumonia is a serious lung infection that’s usually caused by bacteria, a virus or even fungi.
Sufferers’ lungs swell up and their air sacs can fill with fluid, making it very difficult to breathe.
In extreme cases pneumonia can quickly become life-threatening, especially for elderly or very young patients, and those with heart or pre-existing lung problems.
Mitchell was holidaying after his second season in charge of Hawthorn, the club he won four flags and one Brownlow Medal with as a player.
The Hawks coach is surrounded by his family in New York before he will be able to fly home
After taking the Hawks to 13th during his first campaign as coach, the team slipped to 16th in 2023 as the club’s rebuilding phase took its toll and left him with a very young and green list.
Mitchell raised eyebrows when he was inducted into the AFL’s Hall of Fame in June as he failed to mention his coach while he played at Hawthorn, Alastair Clarkson, in his acceptance speech.
Some fans took it as a sign that the pair’s relationship has been badly damaged by the racism scandal that enveloped the club last year.

author: Corinne Purtill - Los Angeles Times (TNS)
title: Doctor surrenders license after allegations that he sexually abused patients and employees | Nation/World | gazettextra.com
text:
LOS ANGELES — A longtime internist who founded a chain of Southern California clinics has surrendered his medical license after an accusation from the state medical board that he sexually assaulted three patients, two of whom worked for his clinics.
Dr. Mohammad Rasekhi signed an agreement to give up his medical license last month, weeks after the Medical Board of California filed an accusation against him detailing allegations that Rasekhi sexually abused three women while they were under his care.
